intro: Shorea scutulata, commonly known as the white ironwood, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae and is characterized by its dense, heavy wood that is highly valued for its strength and durability. The tree can grow up to 40 meters tall and has smooth, greyish bark that becomes fissured with age. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinct midrib, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically appearing in clusters. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native forests, providing habitat and contributing to biodiversity.
